780d699a-196c-4388-9357-19b680aaf81c.description: Through the Temple University NEST (Network of Evaluation Services and Training) Grant Writing Certificate Program, supervisors, managers, directors and emerging leaders learn to develop successful proposals to obtain external funding. The earner of this badge is familiar with steps of the grant writing process and has basic knowledge about the types of grants available and how to look for them.
780d699a-196c-4388-9357-19b680aaf81c.name: Grant Writing Certificate Program

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all 6 weekly sessions, each consisting of two and a half hours of instructor-led training (total instructional time = 15 hours), and complete required assignments for each module.

All learners are encouraged to complete a grant application in response to either a grantor’s Request for Proposal or their published application guidelines for a proposal. Learners who elect to submit a proposal are given feedback.
Other assessments include the development of a Program Logic Model used by funders to plan, implement and evaluate the effectiveness of a program, and a budget for program development and operations.

38bc8ca1-b77d-4b64-9e43-62fee49cd751.description: This program prepares college and university professors and other professionals to teach a semester-long Inside-Out course. The training covers pedagogy, methodology, and curricular development, as well as ethical considerations, emotional concerns, and practical strategies. Three of the training days take place inside of a prison. Participants learn through observation, experience, and engagement with incarcerated individuals who have years of experience in the Inside-Out methodology.
38bc8ca1-b77d-4b64-9e43-62fee49cd751.name: International Inside-Out Instructor Training Institute

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 60 hours of training
Complete a group project of devising a potential 15-week Inside-Out course that demonstrates knowledge of Inside-Out pedagogy, methodology, and curricular development practices
Facilitate a 30-minute lesson for a group of peers

91c866a6-4221-4bd8-9da2-d6aca2a3672f.description: Temple University's Women’s Leadership Series, run by the Fox Center for Executive Education, is designed to develop and foster the skills necessary for successful business leadership. The series provides comprehensive instruction from highly experienced leaders, as well as the opportunity for participants to collaborate and network with other professionals, empowering them to advance to executive roles within their organizations and beyond.
91c866a6-4221-4bd8-9da2-d6aca2a3672f.name: Women's Leadership Series

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least 4 out of 6 sessions

acacd463-bd06-4964-bf8d-b3241ece8aa2.description: The Credential for Strengths-Based Family Workers is a professional training course and credential program with a competency-based curriculum. Through a multi-faceted evaluation process, badge earners are better able to facilitate a family’s ability to set and reach their own goals. While nationally standardized, this training is tailored to meet the needs of local communities and implemented by Lead Agencies or Approved Providers.
acacd463-bd06-4964-bf8d-b3241ece8aa2.name: Strengths-Based Family Workers Credential (2021-2024)

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a minimum of 80 hours of interactive classroom instruction
Complete a skills portfolio demonstrating the 6 Core Competencies that define the qualities of a strengths-based family worker
Pass a National SFW Credentialing exam

bcb7e2f1-7b93-45b1-9cab-f9ded9360c6d.description: The Credential for Strengths-Based Family Workers is a professional training course and credential program with a competency-based curriculum. Through a multi-faceted evaluation process, badge earners are better able to facilitate a family’s ability to set and reach their own goals. While nationally standardized, this training is tailored to meet the needs of local communities and implemented by Lead Agencies or Approved Providers.
bcb7e2f1-7b93-45b1-9cab-f9ded9360c6d.name: Strengths-Based Family Workers Credential (2020-2023)

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a minimum of 80 hours of interactive classroom instruction
Complete a skills portfolio demonstrating the 6 Core Competencies that define the qualities of a strengths-based family worker
Pass a National SFW Credentialing exam

7102d289-76c7-42dc-9d88-c64a6e00a7a7.description: This course is for individuals who received their Credential for Strengths-based Family Workers (SFW) from Temple University Harrisburg. Recredentialing every three years allows workers to demonstrate that they are still competent in strengths-based skills, stay up to date on new developments in the field, and remain connected to the network. Badge earners review topics including empathy and empathic reflection, powerful questions, cultural humility, and communication skills.
7102d289-76c7-42dc-9d88-c64a6e00a7a7.name: Strengths-Based Family Workers Recredential (2019-2022)

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Pass a final exam demonstrating competencies in areas of reflection, empathy, powerful questions, and cultural humility

290b0e5d-63f2-4e68-bb2e-ae5c7a03e27f.description: Temple University's Strengths-Based Leadership Certificate is a five-module program that provides supervisors, managers, directors and emerging leaders with an opportunity to learn and practice skills leading to a more empowered workplace. Badge earners can describe and implement strengths-based techniques for communication, performance management, and collaboration. Earners also reflect on organizational culture and personal leadership values, capacity for change, and cultural humility.
290b0e5d-63f2-4e68-bb2e-ae5c7a03e27f.name: Strengths-Based Leadership Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Submit a final project plan and implement the project for 30 days
Present final project to peers and facilitators
Submit a final report

1b8e2f78-f8db-446b-96a3-1c752f0b7f9c.description: Temple University's Small Business Development Center's Construction Management Certificate Series is a 9-month series of classes designed to provide business management tools to existing and aspiring independent contractors. The earner of this badge has a foundational understanding of key components, best practices and strategies related to construction and business management.
1b8e2f78-f8db-446b-96a3-1c752f0b7f9c.name: Construction Management Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all 12 modules (170 hours of instruction)
Complete a team project, a professional team resume, team project presentation and a business concept paper.

45a632fb-91d4-4c81-a6db-5043226da029.description: Our Strengths-based Family Worker Credential educates workers on the value of using strengths-based language and skills to assist them to build trusting relationships. Our curriculum covers relevant and challenging topics that prove invaluable to workers like nonverbal communication, culture and organizational culture, assessment and measuring progress, family goal plans, the importance of self-care, problem-solving, referrals, ethics, boundaries, confidentiality, and other critical topics.
45a632fb-91d4-4c81-a6db-5043226da029.name: Strengths-Based Family Workers Credential (2022-2025)

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 12 hours of Foundations of Strength-based practice. This course meets virtually via instructor-led Zoom sessions for four consecutive weeks and utilizes breakout rooms to allow for small group and partner interaction. Each Zoom session is three hours long. Pre-course work and post-course discussion takes place in Temple Harrisburg's online learning management system, Canvas.

Complete 6 Core Content courses (44 hours) designed to reflect current, evidence-based content and practices that help professionals practice effectively in today’s environment. These newly improved content courses originated from the original SFW curriculum and through research and feedback from those in the field we have added and improved the content into the new design.

Complete 21 hours of a SFW Practicum. The SFW Practicum course provides a highly interactive and supportive online community for professionals to demonstrate and enhance their strengths-based knowledge and skills. This practicum course is designed to give supervised and supported practical application of the previous coursework. This seven-week online course consists of weekly assignments, group discussions, and feedback from the instructor.

Pass a National SFW Credential exam. The exam covers the knowledge and content learned throughout the 7 prerequisite courses. A score of 80% or higher on the exam must be obtained before access to the practicum is provided.

967b013e-f7b7-4385-ba75-c2ef34a27d8e.description: The Credential for Strengths-Based Family Workers is a professional training course and credential program with a competency-based curriculum. Through a multi-faceted evaluation process, badge earners are better able to facilitate a family’s ability to set and reach their own goals. While nationally standardized, this training is tailored to meet the needs of local communities and implemented by Lead Agencies or Approved Providers.
967b013e-f7b7-4385-ba75-c2ef34a27d8e.name: Strengths-Based Family Workers Credential (2019-2022)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a minimum of 80 hours of interactive classroom instruction
Complete a skills portfolio demonstrating the 6 Core Competencies that define the qualities of a strengths-based family worker
Pass a National SFW Credentialing exam

8e9fb0a3-afff-4c22-a1f4-b3c6016b2a63.description: Temple University's Office of Non-Credit and Continuing Education provides a Certificate in Project Management, designed to provide an overview of the basics of project management to brand-new project managers and to people who have been managing projects for a while but are looking for some more formal tools and strategies. Students who earn this certificate are able to implement hands-on tools for managing all phases of a project.
8e9fb0a3-afff-4c22-a1f4-b3c6016b2a63.name: Certificate in Project Management

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: 30 hours of instruction and study
Completion of a final portfolio/project, assessed by non-credit instructional staff

657365b3-409f-4699-9958-54344d22a59a.description: This course is for individuals who received their Credential for Strengths-based Family Workers (SFW) from Temple University Harrisburg. Recredentialing every three years allows workers to demonstrate that they are still competent in strengths-based skills, stay up to date on new developments in the field, and remain connected to the network. Badge earners review topics including empathy and empathic reflection, powerful questions, cultural humility, and communication skills.
657365b3-409f-4699-9958-54344d22a59a.name: Strengths-Based Family Workers Recredential (2022-2025)

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Assignments and quizzes

Participants will be able to: 1. Recognize the Four Domains of Emotional Intelligence, explain its importance in working with families and use self-assessment to determine their level of Emotional Intelligence. 2. List the Five Core Feelings and 3. Recognize and Understand Emotions and their Role in our Thinking and Reacting.

dce07c37-d1bf-4a74-b508-93342a2884d7.description: Temple University’s Nonprofit Management Certificate prepares participants to manage every aspect of a non-profit organization. Badge earners learn about topics including leadership roles, governance, program design, administrative and financial management, marketing and communications, and resource development. They also work on relationship management, ethical issues, diversity, inclusion, and cultural humility.
dce07c37-d1bf-4a74-b508-93342a2884d7.name: Nonprofit Management Certificate Program

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Achieve an 80% passing grade for each module, through a combination of written assignments, discussion forums, and reflection activities

d902ce2b-a876-451b-bbb1-11f8f373d8c3.description: Temple University Harrisburg in partnership with Fundraising Master Trainer Chad Barger, CFRE, offers an online, 10-week certificate program to help learners take their fundraising to the next level. This immersive self-paced certificate course covers the basics of fundraising through two virtual sessions and 8 online modules that assess learners' knowledge on their journey to earning the FCP Certificate.
d902ce2b-a876-451b-bbb1-11f8f373d8c3.name: Fundraising Certificate Program

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

alignments.name: Certified Fundraising Executive (CFRE)
alignments.description: CFRE International is an independent nonprofit organization whose sole mission is dedicated to setting standards in philanthropy through a valid and reliable certification process for fundraising professionals.

badge_template_activities.title: This course utilizes 2 virtual sessions and 8 online modules to assess learners' knowledge on their journey to completing the FCP.

ecf575d3-94ab-46fc-a634-a9523597e494.description: Understanding and Battling the Disease of Addiction is a one-hour e-learning series offered by Temple University Harrisburg. This free social work approved continuing education course provides convenient online training to anyone interested in helping individuals with substance use disorders. It is comprised of three modules; each module is 20 minutes in length and focuses on elements of disease education, stigma reduction, and motivational interviewing strategies.
ecf575d3-94ab-46fc-a634-a9523597e494.name: Understanding and Battling the Disease of Addiction

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a knowledge check at the end of each of the three modules and upload certification of completion for each module

9abfb6f6-c3c4-4e8c-9e56-ce4b0dae5acf.description: This course is for individuals who received their Credential for Strengths-based Family Workers (SFW) from Temple University Harrisburg. Recredentialing every three years allows workers to demonstrate that they are still competent in strengths-based skills, stay up to date on new developments in the field, and remain connected to the network. Badge earners review topics including empathy and empathic reflection, powerful questions, cultural humility, and communication skills.
9abfb6f6-c3c4-4e8c-9e56-ce4b0dae5acf.name: Strengths-Based Family Workers Recredential (2021-2024)

badge_template_activities.title: Pass a final exam demonstrating competencies in areas of reflection, empathy, powerful questions, and cultural humility

f61eb8e5-be71-454d-baec-cbd6815709e5.description: The Fox/Reinvestment Fund: Leadership Development Program is divided into three modules, consisting of three topics in each module. The topics range from areas that focus on individual improvement, to strengthening interactions with others, and actions that have a broader organizational impact. Participants who complete this program must complete several workshops over nine months and, once finished, will be prepared to be successful team members at Reinvestment Fund.
f61eb8e5-be71-454d-baec-cbd6815709e5.name: Fox/Reinvestment Fund: Leadership Development Program

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants need to attend 7 out of 9 sessions to receive a badge.

00b28c26-ebcf-4522-aeb2-668e5e7dd81a.description: Participants who have completed the Fox/Rothman Micro Executive MBA Workshop Series have attended 20 out of 24 sessions, by either attending live or watching the recordings after the sessions. Participants learn about business acumen topics, ranging from leadership skills, finance fundamentals, effective communication, and more. Participants leave the series with an understanding of practical business skills so they may better serve the mission of Rothman Orthopaedic Institute.
00b28c26-ebcf-4522-aeb2-668e5e7dd81a.name: Fox/Rothman Micro Executive MBA Workshop Series

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must have attended 20 out of 24 sessions, either virtually or live, to receive their badge.

569330f7-b2ab-4a5e-81cb-de6757d6d07a.description: The Digital Marketing Program teaches participants about key digital marketing channels and available strategies. The program is comprised of four, three-hour sessions where participants learn how to think strategically and develop an ROI-based marketing plan. Participants will also explore the collaboration between sales and marketing to better identify prospects, connect with them, and shorten the sales cycle.
569330f7-b2ab-4a5e-81cb-de6757d6d07a.name: Digital Marketing Program

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must participate in at least 2 of the 4 sessions, for a minimum of six hours of education experience.

e8ec4e36-b4b2-4009-881a-ada777443c96.description: This badge is awarded by Temple University's Center for Inclusive Competitiveness, and is given to students who can explain how closed-loop aquaponic systems evolved and their contribution to sustainability goals in agriculture. Badge earners build an operating ecosystem that raises fish and grows food.
e8ec4e36-b4b2-4009-881a-ada777443c96.name: Aquaponics

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate proficiency in building and maintaining an aquaponics system (caring for both fish and plants), including starting seeds, monitoring water quality and system health
Describe how the system's efficiency compares to other farming methods
Identify how aquaponics could help achieve the UN Sustainable Development Goals

75b3da0d-781d-4751-a2ef-dfaafea59db9.description: This badge is awarded by Temple University’s Center for Inclusive Competitiveness, and is given to students who engage diverse community leaders and present on the UN sustainable development goals as they relate to Philadelphia. Badge earners are able to demonstrate skills in communicating and collaborating across generations outside of the classroom space.
75b3da0d-781d-4751-a2ef-dfaafea59db9.name: Community Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and speak or present at a community sustainability event
Demonstrate positive, clear communication skills as a young leader
Demonstrate professionalism networking with community leaders

5e39169f-2e94-4514-8a6c-38f2fcb900c4.description: Participants in the Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: Building Basic Competency Program develop skills for working effectively in a diverse setting. During the three-session program, participants learn fundamental concepts around cultural difference, biases and their impact on workplace structures, and how to evaluate and improve their workplace climates. Additionally, participants learn how to think strategically about their own workplace challenges and share their insights with one another.
5e39169f-2e94-4514-8a6c-38f2fcb900c4.name: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: Building Basic Competency Program

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least 2 out of the 3 sessions.

25f43350-b26d-41b5-8b77-08e0e128fedc.description: This badge is awarded by Temple University's Center for Inclusive Competitiveness, and is given to students who successfully install and program a data collection sensor for an indoor growing system. Badge earners gain basic computer programming skills in technology applications for urban agriculture.
25f43350-b26d-41b5-8b77-08e0e128fedc.name: Computer Science Sensor

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Download a sensor’s code library, run the app using C++, and test for accuracy
Demonstrate ability to collect and interpret data from installed sensors, and describe proposed changes to the system based on sensor data feedback

4ef520ea-0c65-4e8e-b3fb-a10b28681161.description: This badge is awarded to students taking professional development programs through Temple University's Office of Non-Credit and Continuing Education. Students who earn this badge have completed ten hours of study towards their professional development course or certificate program.
4ef520ea-0c65-4e8e-b3fb-a10b28681161.name: ONCE: 10 hours of continuing education

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Ten hours of study

3ee56aa4-8c0b-45f6-b6a5-333bbda685ec.description: The United Safety Leadership Development program supported the growth of United Safety’s managers, enabling further development of their leadership and managerial skills. Participants had to complete 6, 4-hour, online courses covering a variety of business acumen topics: Coaching and Performance Management, Strategic Thinking, Emotional Intelligence, Becoming an Inclusive Leader, Building High-Performing Teams, and Leading in a Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, and Ambiguous Environment.
3ee56aa4-8c0b-45f6-b6a5-333bbda685ec.name: United Safety & Survivability Corporation: Leadership Development Program

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners attended a total of 24 hours of online education.

7af49650-da26-4b9b-a13c-00971162f3a4.description: This badge is awarded by Temple University's Center for Inclusive Competitiveness, and is focused on the Engineering Design Process. It is awarded to students who apply the process to a problem and create solutions. Badge earners practice using engineering design thinking, and understand that design is a multi-dimensional process beyond solely identifying problems and creating solutions.
7af49650-da26-4b9b-a13c-00971162f3a4.name: Engineering Design

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate ability to explain each step in the Engineering Design Process
Identify a real world problem and apply each EDP step in the process, proposing sustainable ways to strengthen their solution after identifying design gaps

937d78f1-b317-48a0-82da-c02535202af3.description: This badge is issued by Temple University's Center for Inclusive Competitiveness, and represents badge represents a set of personal, technical and community leadership skills that serve as a foundation for applying science, engineering and technology to confront equitable access to nutritious food, renewable energy and clean water in urban areas. Badge earners have a unique commitment to solving these problems, and accomplishing positive collective impact in sustainable ways.
937d78f1-b317-48a0-82da-c02535202af3.name: STEM for Urban Sustainability

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title:
Complete all of the following badges: Community Leadership,
Sustainability,
Computer Science Sensor,
Engineering Design,
Aquaponics,
Cultural Competency

b6f2bfa5-b6f8-4396-b72e-88b9e2ecd1d7.description: This badge is awarded by Temple University's Center for Inclusive Competitiveness, and is given to students who can explain how different cultural groups use engineered technologies in their farming and/or gardening practices. Badge earners practice working with people of diverse backgrounds and identities to cultivate perspective sharing and consensus building.
b6f2bfa5-b6f8-4396-b72e-88b9e2ecd1d7.name: Cultural Competency

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Conduct research on at least one cultural group that’s new to the student, using interviews to determine how the group uses low, moderate and/or advanced technology to grow food, reduce waste or save energy
Present on how to share ideas with other cultural groups

eacc841b-b566-4c40-8de2-e9f823ea0da2.description: Temple University's Office of Non-Credit and Continuing Education provides a Certificate in Editing and Business Writing. This program provides participants with a range of strategies for editing and proof-reading to a high standard. Students cover grammar and style rules, and work on both editing their own writing and that of other people.
eacc841b-b566-4c40-8de2-e9f823ea0da2.name: Certificate in Editing and Business Writing

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: 30 hours of instruction and study
Completion of a final portfolio/project, assessed by non-credit instructional staff

7374e2c1-b222-4863-ae4c-074d277d0843.description: Temple University's "Case Champion" badge is earned by distinguished Fox/STHM faculty members, DBA students, and PhD students, who have made significant contributions in business case writing and teaching at the school. Earners of this badge can describe key components, best practices, and strategies when writing and teaching using cases, and serve as peer mentors to others interested in writing business cases. Earners can complete elements from a range of criteria to earn the badge.
7374e2c1-b222-4863-ae4c-074d277d0843.name: Case Champion

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Badge recipients can earn points towards their badge for the number of cases they have published with a well-recognized publisher in the last five years. Additional points are earned based on the total number of sales by unit.
Badge recipients can earn points towards their badge by adopting a teaching case (self-authored or otherwise) in their syllabus for at least four semesters over the 5-year period.

Badge recipients can earn points towards their badge by participating in a podcast that is available online; creating a professional video on their teaching case, which is now on Fox’s YouTube channel; presenting in a Case Writing Conference; or serving on a Case Writing Round Table Discussion or Panel.

Badge recipients can earn points towards their badge by volunteering as a judge or a peer-reviewer in a case writing competition/ conference, or by serving as a peer-mentor for case writers (student competitions do not qualify for this activity).
Badge recipients can earn points towards their badge by winning a case writing award in the last five years.
Badge recipients can earn points towards their badge by being active on social media (LinkedIn or Twitter) with case writing or publishing updates.

68bca7bc-2ecb-4de3-8063-6367c4d0c79b.description: Temple University's Office of Non-Credit and Continuing Education provides a Certificate in Interior Design. This program provides an overview of the fundamentals of interior design, including deep dives into specifics of furniture, fabrics, lighting, and accessories, as well as principles of room layout and color schemes. Analysis of room designs is conducted through conversation with the instructor.
68bca7bc-2ecb-4de3-8063-6367c4d0c79b.name: Certificate in Interior Design

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: 30 hours of instruction and study

7df108e3-03ec-4184-8831-2e0deb6add5a.description: Temple University's Office of Non-Credit and Continuing Education provides a Certificate in Leadership and Management. This program provides new managers, or people looking to take a step up in their careers, with foundational leadership skills to effectively lead and motivate teams using tools of emotional intelligence, strengths-based communication, and results-based goal-setting.
7df108e3-03ec-4184-8831-2e0deb6add5a.name: Certificate in Leadership and Management

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: 30 hours of instruction and study
Completion of a final portfolio/project, assessed by non-credit instructional staff

This practicum course is designed to give supervised and supported practical application of the previous coursework. This seven-week online course consists of weekly assignments, group discussions, and feedback from the instructor.

Pass a National SFW Credential exam. The exam covers the knowledge and content learned throughout the 7 prerequisite courses. A score of 80% or higher on the exam must be obtained before access to the practicum is provided.

f61eef58-4f7f-4742-9cb0-10d086f7eb1f.description: The Board Leadership Program: Elevate Your Impact, run by the Fox Center for Executive Education, is designed to enhance the effectiveness of prospective and current members of nonprofit boards of directors. The program covers topics including board recruitment and onboarding, the importance of cultivating a diverse board, effectively strategizing for the future of the nonprofit, and more. The program is led by accomplished speakers and features structured discussion and breakout sessions.
f61eef58-4f7f-4742-9cb0-10d086f7eb1f.name: Board Leadership Program

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must attend at least half of the program sessions in order to receive the digital badge of completion.

e7e58883-fb38-4d3f-9a38-7fdeca8376e5.description: This course is for individuals who received their Credential for Strengths-based Family Workers (SFW) from Temple University Harrisburg. Recredentialing every three years allows workers to demonstrate that they are still competent in strengths-based skills, stay up to date on new developments in the field, and remain connected to the network. Badge earners review topics including empathy and empathic reflection, powerful questions, cultural humility, and communication skills.
e7e58883-fb38-4d3f-9a38-7fdeca8376e5.name: Strengths-Based Family Workers Recredential (2020-2023)

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Pass a final exam demonstrating competencies in areas of reflection, empathy, powerful questions, and cultural humility

0fc535fd-05ec-4ff4-a0c2-0f0279a41b54.description: The Agile Leadership Workshop provides emerging leaders with the experience, capabilities, and tools to design and lead successful transformation and change programs. This two-session, six-hour interactive workshop will allow participants to gain practical experience putting agile and leadership practices together. Participants will learn how to develop a business case to gain support and then continue to drive executive engagement.
0fc535fd-05ec-4ff4-a0c2-0f0279a41b54.name: Agile Leadership Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants need to attend and participate in six hours of programming across two sessions.

4a65d0bd-7f5d-48ad-b939-2f5f8446416a.description: Temple University SBDC's "Rethinking Business in the Age of COVID-19" is designed to provide aspiring entrepreneurs with the tools and information needed to create a professional business plan in the COVID world. Earners have the foundational knowledge to start a small business venture as well as grow an existing one. The earner can describe key components, best practices and strategies for topics, including marketing, sales, operations, competitive analysis, strategic positioning, and finances.
4a65d0bd-7f5d-48ad-b939-2f5f8446416a.name: Rethinking Business in the Age of COVID-19

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Engage in and attend all sessions of the 6-week program
Complete weekly in-class and homework assignments to facilitate the creation of a business plan narrative
Deliver a Business Pitch on the final night of class

c030ebcb-8aac-4195-b1cd-00dc63a68e4a.description: Motivational Interviewing (MI) is a collaborative conversation used to strengthen motivation and commitment to change. This course is for a broad spectrum of health and service providers working with clients and patients who have opioid or other substance use disorders. The core MI information is applicable across a broad spectrum of needs and issues. The content is evidence-based, versatile, and can be used for anyone working with those focused on improving their life.
c030ebcb-8aac-4195-b1cd-00dc63a68e4a.name: Motivational Interviewing for Health and Service Providers

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

alignments.name: Motivational Interviewing Network of Trainers
alignments.description: The Motivational Interviewing Network of Trainers has a website dedicated to comprehensive coverage of Motivational Interviewing, including a robust resources page.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must complete two virtual live sessions and two online self-paced modules, for a total of 10 hours of training.
Interactive exercises, practice exercises, and quizzes are part of all four modules.

7bcf70ec-baae-4588-863c-f11ca82e9cbb.description: This badge is awarded to students taking professional development programs through Temple University's Office of Non-Credit and Continuing Education. Students who earn this badge have completed twenty five hours of study towards their professional development course or certificate program.
7bcf70ec-baae-4588-863c-f11ca82e9cbb.name: ONCE: 25 hours of continuing education

c026a56f-7923-4249-82aa-43e8974e0403.description: This badge is awarded to students taking professional development programs through Temple University's Office of Non-Credit and Continuing Education. Students who earn this badge have completed fifty hours of study towards their professional development course or certificate program.
c026a56f-7923-4249-82aa-43e8974e0403.name: ONCE: 50 hours of continuing education

3aba5e27-ed40-4728-9ea7-5b017980170f.description: What does it mean to create a safe environment for the people we serve? In today’s world, trauma has affected almost everyone directly or indirectly. Often, these individuals are unintentionally re-victimized by well-meaning people. This course will help you to learn how to approach clients using a trauma-informed lens. In this course, you will learn about the various types of trauma, the long-lasting effects of trauma, and what it means to provide care through a trauma-informed lens.
3aba5e27-ed40-4728-9ea7-5b017980170f.name: Strengths-Based Family Workers Recredential (2023-2026)

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: After completing this course, participants will be able to: Identify the different types of trauma, their effects on the brain, and what it means to be trauma-informed.

b3ec2e4a-8bdb-4bd2-b926-895bfdc5ac49.description: This badge is awarded by Temple University's Center for Inclusive Competitiveness, and is given to students who demonstrate an understanding of at least 5 of the 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Badge earners are able to analyze local sustainability challenges associated with climate change.
b3ec2e4a-8bdb-4bd2-b926-895bfdc5ac49.name: Sustainability

issuer.summary: issued by Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

entity.name: Temple University Non-Credit and Continuing Education

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the global evolution of the UN SDG and the agreements to address them
Create a social media visual/oral/written/or multimedia “ad” regarding SDG impact
Present a map overlay showing energy, water and food projections in Philadelphia
